disable: DC 45 Arcana (legendary), Occultism (legendary), or Performance (legendary) to soothe or divert the kyokor's attention; using a guardian orb (see the sidebar) to command the kyokor ends the hazard
reset: The kyokor's tentacles can't writhe again for 1d4 rounds.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam
actions.trigger: A creature takes a hostile action against the kyokor, produces a visible area effect, or flies within 120 feet of the kyokor
actions.effect: The kyokor deals 6d10+28 bludgeoning damage in a 120-foot line, and each creature in the area must attempt a DC 40 Reflex save.

name: Reactor Meltdown
description: A nuclear reactor overloads, then explodes.
disable: DC 45 Computers (master) or Crafting (master) to initiate shutdown procedures, or DC 47 Thievery (master) to vent the reactor; three total successes are required to disable the trap

actions.name: Radiation Leak
actions.trigger: A creature views the reactor's sensors or console
actions.effect: Creatures within 60 feet of the reactor are exposed to incredible radiation (DC 32 Fortitude). The trap rolls initiative.

actions.name: Nuclear Explosion
actions.trigger: The trap completed its routine with a radius of 100 feet
actions.effect: The reactor explodes, dealing 4d10+20 fire damage in a 500 foot radius, bypassing the hardness of any items in the blast zone (DC 46 basic Fortitude save). Everything in the area is exposed to incredible radiation. The area of the nuclear explosion becomes irradiated, leaking severe radiation for 50 years.

routine: As the reactor overheats, the trap deals 4d10+20 fire damage to creatures within 60 feet (DC 42 basic Fortitude save). All creatures in the area are exposed to incredible radiation.

name: Memory Crystals
description: Glowing yellow crystals refract the blurred imprints of stolen memories within their facets.
disable: DC 48 Arcana (legendary) to erect mental wards, or DC 48 Occultism (legendary) to harmlessly feed surface thoughts to the crystals, or DC 51 Religion (legendary) to pray for protection from the crystals
reset: After expanding, the memory crystals can't grow again for 1 day.

actions.name: Leech Memories
actions.trigger: A non-mindless creature comes within 5 feet of the memory crystals
actions.effect: The memory crystals expand into every square adjacent to their space. As they grow, they absorb memories and ambient thought from their surroundings, dealing 8d10 mental damage (DC 42 basic Will save) to creatures within 10 feet after they expand.

name: Terrible Roar
description: The kyokor unleashes a terrible roar.
disable: DC 50 Arcana (legendary), Occultism (legendary), or Performance (legendary) to counteract the roar
reset: The kyokor must wait 1d4 rounds before roaring again.

actions.name: Thundering Roar
actions.effect: (sonic) **Trigger** A creature takes a hostile action against the kyokor, produces a visible area effect, or flies within 120 feet of the kyokor; **Effect** The kyokor roars, producing a 120-foot cone of sound in the direction of the triggering creature. Unattended objects of 5 or less Hardness immediately gain the broken condition, and concrete and metal surfaces warp into difficult terrain. Creatures in the area take 20d6 sonic damage (DC 44 basic Fortitude save). On a failure, a creature also takes 3d6 persistent mental damage and is sickened 2.
